intro: Onosma wheeler-hainesii, commonly known as Wheeler-Haines' onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae, which is characterized by hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, where it thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with five petals that are often glandular-dotted. This species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
